thread.title: FAA Moved Slower Than Usual on Engine Warning Ahead of Southwest Fatality

author: Andy Pasztor
title: FAA Moved Slower Than Usual on Engine Warning Ahead of Southwest Fatality

organizations.name: engine warning ahead of southwest fatality investigators

text:
Investigators have yet to issue their final report on a Southwest Airlines Co. flight last month that ended in an emergency landing and a passenger’s death. But one thing is clear: Regulators had been weighing enhanced inspection requirements covering a suspect engine part for nearly two years—an unusually long time—after warnings about it first emerged.
Questions about the time it took regulators to mandate more comprehensive inspections—and whether an alternate response would have made a difference in uncovering what emerged... RELATED VIDEO Southwest Flight 1380: What Happened Onboard The Wall Street Journal used video shared on social media and other reporting to piece together how the engine on Southwest Airlines flight 1380 broke apart, ultimately killing a passenger and forcing an emergency landing. Photo: Marty Martinez
